title: FL DOS Corp - Centurion + Sullivan Brothers

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to Chapter 119, Florida Statutes (Florida Sunshine Law), I hereby request access to the following public records:

1. All filings, regulatory review documents, correspondence, and internal communications related to the acquisition of Centurion Equity, Inc. by the Sullivan Brothers Family of Companies.

2. Any records indicating state involvement, oversight, or awareness of this transaction, including but not limited to:
a. Communications with regulatory agencies, legal counsel, or corporate officers.
b. Compliance reviews, due diligence assessments, or state approval documents.
c. Meeting notes or internal discussions regarding the implications of the acquisition.

I request that these records be provided in electronic format (searchable PDFs or native digital formats, if available) via email. If email is not feasible, please provide the records via CD-ROM or USB drive.

I request a waiver of any associated fees under Chapter 119, Florida Statutes, as the requested documents serve the public interest by promoting government transparency and corporate accountability. These records are intended for broad public dissemination and are not for commercial purposes. However, if fees are unavoidable, please provide an estimate before fulfilling the request.

As required under Florida law, I anticipate your response within 10 business days. Please confirm receipt of this request at your earliest convenience.

Thank you for your time and cooperation.

Sincerely,

Ashley Burson

title: FLDOC + Gov Ofc (Executive Office of the Governor of Florida)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to Chapter 119, Florida Statutes (Florida Sunshine Law), I hereby request access to the following public records:

All communications, including emails, memos, meeting notes, reports, and directives, exchanged between the Florida Department of Corrections (FDC) and the Office of the Governor from January 1, 2018, to the present, regarding:

1. The "privatization strategy" for Florida’s prison healthcare system.
2. The criteria, selection process, and decision-making factors for awarding healthcare contracts.
3. Any references to "Centurion"  | "Centene" | or any Sullivan Brother Family-owned company, including Sullivan Brother Investments.

I request that these records be provided in electronic format (searchable PDFs, native digital files, or email exports, if available) via email. If email is not feasible, please provide the records via CD-ROM or USB drive.

I request a waiver of any associated fees under Chapter 119, Florida Statutes, as the requested documents serve the public interest by contributing to transparency and accountability in government operations. These records are intended for broad public dissemination and not for commercial use. However, if fees are unavoidable, please provide an estimate before fulfilling the request.

As required under Florida law, I expect a response within a reasonable timeframe, not exceeding 10 business days. Please confirm receipt of this request at your earliest convenience.

Thank you for your time and cooperation.

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to Chapter 119, Florida Statutes (Florida Sunshine Law), I hereby request access to the following public records:

All communications, including emails, memos, meeting notes, reports, and directives, exchanged between the Florida Department of Corrections (FDC) and the Office of the Governor from January 1, 2018, to the present, regarding:

1. The "privatization strategy" for Florida’s prison healthcare system.
2. The criteria, selection process, and decision-making factors for awarding healthcare contracts.
3. Any references to "Centurion"  | "Centene" | or any Sullivan Brother Family-owned company, including Sullivan Brother Investments.

I request that these records be provided in electronic format (searchable PDFs, native digital files, or email exports, if available) via email. If email is not feasible, please provide the records via CD-ROM or USB drive.

I request a waiver of any associated fees under Chapter 119, Florida Statutes, as the requested documents serve the public interest by contributing to transparency and accountability in government operations. These records are intended for broad public dissemination and not for commercial use. However, if fees are unavoidable, please provide an estimate before fulfilling the request.

As required under Florida law, I expect a response within a reasonable timeframe, not exceeding 10 business days. Please confirm receipt of this request at your earliest convenience.

Thank you for your time and cooperation.

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to Chapter 119, Florida Statutes (Florida Sunshine Law), I respectfully request access to the following public records:

1. All emails, memos, meeting minutes, and related internal communications from January 2022 to the date of this request concerning the negotiation, decision-making, and awarding of the healthcare contract to Centurion of Florida, LLC. 

This includes but is not limited to communications involving the Florida Department of Corrections (FDC) Secretary, procurement officers, legal counsel (not privileged), and other officials involved in contract deliberations. Please also be sure to include records related to:

a. Cost comparisons with previous healthcare providers
b. Performance evaluations of Centurion or other bidders
c. Concerns raised about the privatization process

2.  All internal audit reports, risk assessments, cost–benefit analyses, policy documents, and consultant reports used to justify or guide the awarding of the Centurion contract. This includes documents discussing alternative providers, service quality concerns, financial assessments, or anticipated cost savings.

3.  All records of internal complaints, whistleblower reports, investigations, or disciplinary actions related to medical neglect, staffing shortages, or administrative deficiencies within Florida’s prison healthcare system, specifically mentioning Centurion of Florida, LLC, or any other private healthcare provider under state contract.

I request that these records be provided in electronic format (searchable PDF or native digital format, when available) via email. If email is not feasible, please provide the records via CD-ROM or USB drive.

I also request a waiver of any fees associated with fulfilling this request, as the requested documents are in the public interest and intended for broad public dissemination, not for commercial purposes. However, if fees are unavoidable, please inform me of the estimated cost before proceeding.

As per Florida’s public records law, I anticipate your response within 10 business days. Thank you for your time and cooperation. Please confirm receipt of this request at your earliest convenience.

Sincerely,

Ashley Burson

title: Communications with and records related to Whitman-Walker

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Communications with and records related to Whitman-Walker
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide all records since January 20, 2025 at noon Eastern time which reference the following:

* Whitman-Walker
* an email address at whitman-walker.org
* mention or are related to one or more of the following awards:
   * FAIN H8026632
   * PIID UH3AI133674
   * FAIN NU62PS924784

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

realmaga
